DataElement.preferredName: Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index Q10 Past Month Have Bed Partner Or Room Mate Score 4 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Persons' stated perception in the past month of having a bed partner or roommate and where that person sleeps, using a 4 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index Past Month Have Bed Partner or Roommate Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A self-rated questionnaire which assesses sleep quality and disturbances over a one month time interval._Before the present time._One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks._A question about whether an individual has a bed partner or roommate._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A self-rated questionnaire which assesses sleep quality and disturbances over a one month time interval.

Concepts.definition: A self-rated questionnaire which assesses sleep quality and disturbances over a one month time interval.

Property.preferredName: Past Month Have Bed Partner or Roommate Score
Property.preferredDefinition: Before the present time.:One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.:A question about whether an individual has a bed partner or roommate.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.
A question about whether an individual has a bed partner or roommate.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.origin: PSQI:Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index, Buysse DJ, Reynolds CF, Monk TH, Berman SR, Kupfer DJ. University of Pittsburgh, 1989.
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for PRO-HRQoL as part of the Round 6 CRF Data Collection Standards. mc 4/30/15; released on 08/31/2015 ylu

ValueDomain.preferredName: PSQI Roommate Score 4 Point Likert Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard for the subjective scoring of a person's roommate status that ranges from 0: No bed partner or room mate to 3: Partner in same bed.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: No bed partner or room mate

ValueMeaning.preferredName: No bed partner or room mate
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual does not have a bed partner or roommate.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual does not have a bed partner or roommate.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has a partner or roommate who does not share their bedroom.

Concepts.longName: Partner or Roommate in Other Room
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual has a partner or roommate who does not share their bedroom.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Partner in same room, but not same bed

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Partner in same room, but not same bed
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has a partner who shares their bedroom but does not share the same bed.

Concepts.longName: Partner in Same Room, But Not Same Bed
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual has a partner who shares their bedroom but does not share the same bed.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has a partner who shares their bed.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual has a partner who shares their bed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ValueDomain.origin: PSQI:Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index, Buysse DJ, Reynolds CF, Monk TH, Berman SR, Kupfer DJ. University of Pittsburgh, 1989.
ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created for PRO-HRQoL as part of the Round 6 CRF Data Collection Standards. mc 4/28/15; released on 08/31/2015 ylu

ReferenceDocuments.name: Scoring and Interpretation Link
ReferenceDocuments.description: Scoring and Interpretation materials are available on the University of Pittsburg, Sleep Medicine Institute website.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. Where an investigator wants to use single Patient Reported Outcome items that are integrated into a study, DCP review is required prior to inclusion of the item on a case report form.
